availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Smith (Hardin County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Hannah Smith. Father of James Smith, David Smith, Elijah Smith, Mary E. Smith, and George R. Smith. Farmer in Hardin County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Hardin County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved individuals in Hardin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 3, p. 357B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 2, p. 213.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 2, p. 9.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Elizabethtown, p. 302A.
Find A Grave, "George Washington Smith (Mar 15, 1813-May 5, 1892)," Memorial #68114396, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68114396 (accessed April 13, 2020).
